comments.body: nit: the example could be a more generic, but it's ok to me!

diffHunk:
@@ -1,1 +107,111 @@- name: Run a manifest with debug, log to both syslog and stdout, specify module path
  puppet:
    modulepath: /etc/puppet/modules:/opt/stack/puppet-modules:/usr/share/openstack-puppet/modules
    logdest: all
    manifest: /var/lib/example/puppet_step_config.pp

comments.body: Will it be obvious to Puppet users when to set this?
Yes, it's a standard puppet feature.  If a user has a need to alter noop (no-operation) they'll know what it is.

diffHunk:
@@ -1,1 +35,39 @@  noop:
    description:
      - Override puppet.conf noop mode.
      - Undefined, use default or puppet.conf value if defined.
      - true, Run Puppet agent with C(--noop) switch set.
